data.title: Cairo Southern Cemetery Mosque & Mausoleum of Imam al-Layth ibn Sa'd 1786 Ottoman Entrance Portal (1e)
data.meta_description:
Imam al-Layth ibn Sa'd (al-Layth ibn Saʿd ibn ʿAbd al-Raḥmān al-Fahmi al-Qalqashandī, nicknamed Abu Al-Harith) 712-791, chief representative, Imam, and founder of the Laythi school of Islamic Jurisprudence.
	
	He was buried here in a simple grave but a splendid tomb was constructed in 1244 by Sultan al-Salih Ayyub (r.1240-1249). In 1833, Isma'il Bay rebuilt the whole complex in its present form.
	
	Buried here are:
	Sa'ad Abd al-Rahim, his father;
	Shu'ayb, his brother;
	Muhammad ibn Harun, his step brother.
	
	Islamic Monument #286
data.text:
Imam al-Layth ibn Sa'd (al-Layth ibn Saʿd ibn ʿAbd al-Raḥmān al-Fahmi al-Qalqashandī, nicknamed Abu Al-Harith) 712-791, chief representative, Imam, and founder of the Laythi school of Islamic Jurisprudence.

He was buried here in a simple grave but a splendid tomb was constructed in 1244 by Sultan al-Salih Ayyub (r.1240-1249). In 1833, Isma'il Bay rebuilt the whole complex in its present form.

Buried here are:

Sa'ad Abd al-Rahim, his father;

Shu'ayb, his brother;

Muhammad ibn Harun, his step brother.

Islamic Monument #286
